entry.title: 6/3 - Call for Artists - National Juried Exhibition
entry.content:
South Arkansas Arts Center
üìç El Dorado, AR, United States
üé® All Visual Arts
üìÖ 06/03/2019 deadline
üí∞ $10.00 fee
‚û° Apply


====== DESCRIPTION ======

2019 Annual Juried Art Competition for all 2-D and 3-D fine art media hosted at the South Arkansas Arts Center in El Dorado Arkansas. The exhibit is open to all 2D or 3D art; traditional and alternate media, as well as innovative and experimental approaches accepted. Open to US artists with artwork completed in the last five years. $2000 in cash prizes.

Juror: Ren√© Paul Barilleaux, the McNay Art Museum in San Antonio, Texas.

Online Entry Deadline: June 3
Juror Announcement: June 12
Exhibit: July 3-30
Artist‚Äôs Reception: July 13, 6pm


===== INSTRUCTIONS =====

Enter: submit digital images online or by mail by June 3, 2019
if submitting a video, include a link to where it can be viewed online
Fee: $10 per entry, pay via paypal, credit card or check by mail
More Information 870-862-5474
Click Link to go to Entry Page

entry.title: Call for Submissions: Artists and Curators
entry.content:
Catskill Art Society
üìç Livingston Manor , NY, United States
üé® All Visual Arts
üìÖ deadline
üí∞ unknown fee
‚û° Apply


====== DESCRIPTION ======

CAS will accept applications from artists and curators in all mediums, including and not limited to digital, fiber, film/video, illustration, installations, performance, pottery and sculpture. Please note artists who presented their work as part of the 2019 season will not be eligible to re-apply until 2021. CAS Arts Center, 48 Main Street will be closed January through September for renovation and expansion. The Laundry King, 65 Main Street will host the CAS exhibition program during that time. Winter hours will be in effect January through April, with the space open Friday - Sundays, and Monday‚Äôs on holiday weekends. CAS Arts Center programming will resume in October.

All proposals will be reviewed by the CAS Artists Council, a newly formed a group of professional mid-career and established visual, literary and performing artists local to the Catskill area acting as stewards and advocates for the organization‚Äôs curatorial pursuits in relation to exhibitions, education, programs, lectures and performances. Artist Council members include and are not limited to Mac Adams, Ellen Brooks, Francis Cape, Carol Hepper, Mary Lucier, Patterson Sims, Robin Winters and Bing Wright. CAS will notify all applicants of the Artists Council‚Äôs decision by July 2019. All work will be considered for solo and group shows at CAS Arts Center or the Laundry King at the recommendation of the Artist Council.


===== INSTRUCTIONS =====

To apply online, please visit http://catskillartsociety.squarespace.com Please direct any questions to Sally Wright, Executive Director at info@catskillartsociety.org.
